title: Romantic Irvine
name: Romantic Irvine
description:
A Map by Baostar

Irvine may not have an Eiffel Tower or Golden Gate Bridge or centuries-old bistros, but romance is not dead in this city. We have our own views of twinkling lights, meandering pathways, rippling reflections, sparkling entertainment areas for strolling, quiet restaurants for candlelight dinners, and acres of open places for getting away from it all and looking at the sunset or sunrise.

properties.name: Bench at the top of Chaparral Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  There\'s a trail behind Bonita Canyon School, in Chaparral Park, that leads to the top of the hill. Up there is a bench where you sit and can look out at the hills on one side and the city lights on the other.

properties.name: Bridge at Mason Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   18712 University Drive, Irvine, CA 92612-2601

properties.name: Ferris Wheel at Irvine Spectrum
properties.description: Posted by Baostar71 Fortune Drive, Irvine, CAThis Ferris Wheel rises 108 feet tall (more than 10 stories high) and is sometimes referred to as "The Great Wheel". It is hand-crafted from Italy and has approximately 18,000 twinkling, patterned bulbs attached to it, making the trip of the lights fantastic to watch.

properties.name: French 75
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 13290 Jamboree Rd., Irvine, CA 92602French 75 is a lively Parisian bistro offering French comfort food and American bistro classics including French Onion Soup, Steak Frites, fresh seafood, traditional crepes, and our famous soufflés. Décor features red leather booths, stamped tin ceilings, vintage posters and decorative period lighting. The sexy red-glass bar features signature martinis, champagne cocktails, Alsatian beers and French & Californian wines by the glass and carafe, along with a lounge menu of small plates and shared items. Live entertainment and a lush lounge provide perfect ‘chill-out’ ambience. Private dining is available.

properties.name: Irvine Barclay Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 4242 Campus Dr, Irvine, CA 92612The Barclay is a marvelous local theater that brings a wide variety of entertainers and performers to Orange County. Home to the UC Irvine\'s drama department and to Ballet Pacifica, many nationally recognized comedians also make tours stops at the Barclay. Chamber music and opera are regular calendar offerings, as the facility\'s intimate size and good acoustics make every audience member feel close to the action.

properties.name: Mason Regional Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  18712 University Dr., Irvine, CA 92612At 345 acres, one of Orange County\'s most popular regional parks…a wonderful blend of nature and recreational opportunities, including walking paths, picnic area and a Frisbee course. Operated by the County of Orange Harbors, Beaches & Parks. For more information, call the park, (949) 854-2491.

properties.name: More than a stolen kiss
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   55 Deerwood West, Irvine, CA 92604More than a stolen kiss A love-struck man stole an aluminum picnic table from a city park to propose to his girlfriend, but will the engagement be tarnished by the police? BY SONYA SMITH and GREG HARDESTY IRVINE WORLD NEWS She stole his heart. He stole a city picnic table. For lovesick Stefan Robichaux, it all made sense. Nothing would keep the 24-yearold international sales coordinator for Oakley from popping the question to his longtime “Lady Faire,” Naomi Goetz, 23, whom he met nearly 12 years earlier. Not even a little larceny. So, on a recent early Saturday morning – Robichaux would say “under the cover of a moonless night” – the former Marine and lover of all things poetic hit Deerfield Community Park. With the help of two friends, he unbolted the picnic table where he and Goetz first kissed, on Nov. 4, 2000. The three put the 00 aluminum bench in Robichaux’s truck and drove off. “This bench will be returned no later than 23:59 hours (PST) on June 30, 2006,” Robichaux wrote in an e-mail to city officials the next day. “Operation Purple Steel,” as he had dubbed it, had begun without a hitch. “If you’re not gonna propose in Paris, you’ve got to do it in style,” Robichaux said. He jotted down a few lines to mark his elaborate engagement scheme: A bench will be stolen, A question will be asked, A ring will be given, And eternity will begin … He forgot one line: The police will be asking questions. A TALE OF ROMANCE Robichaux and Goetz met in 1994 during a five-day church camp in Anaheim. Both were in the sixth grade. “We shamelessly flirted,” Goetz said. Their paths wouldn’t cross again until they both ended up as juniors at a small private high school in Anaheim. They became good friends. After graduating, Robichaux joined the Marines. She wrote to him and sent him cookies. While stationed at Camp Pendleton, Robichaux and Goetz frequently got together on weekends. They’d go to dinner, see movies. Still friends. One night, while taking Goetz home to her parents’ home in Irvine, Robichaux suggested a walk through Deerfield Park. They sat on a bench and exchanged their first kiss. More than friends. Circumstances would keep them apart for the next several years as Goetz went to Cal State Poly in Pomona and Robichaux was sent to Texas. The two lost touch until last fall when Goetz sent her old flame an e-mail. Robichaux was no longer in the Marines and had moved to Anaheim. Goetz was finishing up her last year as an architectural major. The two hooked up. “Everything clicked. The timing was just right,” Goetz said. The romance led to talk of marriage, but how to propose? It had to be with the bench, Robichaux decided. After he stole the picnic table, Robichaux painted it purple – Goetz’s favorite color – and placed in on a hilltop overlooking Mission Viejo. On the big night, a friend dropped Goetz off at Deerfield Community Park. Robichaux was standing where the bench once stood, holding a bouquet of white calla lilies, grinning widely. He drove her to the picnic bench. It was dark. Candles flickered on the table. A bottle of champagne chilled. Music played from a boom box. Tiki torches danced in the wind. Right away, Goetz recognized the bench. “I quickly put it all together,” she said. Robichaux proposed. She said yes. “Every proposal is special,” Goetz said. “But the lengths he went to was amazing.” Robichaux whisked his fiancée to a nearby friend’s house, where family and friends congratulated the couple and laughed about the picnic table. The theft of that table is a misdemeanor and is punishable by six months in jail or a fine up to ,000, or both. Showing no mercy for the romance tale, Irvine Police Commander Dave Freedland says he’d like to “have a chat with the suspect.” Goetz said she isn’t bothered by the theft because her fiancé notified authorities right away. He plans to accept any fines or penalties for the misdemeanor. “He’s truly a prince among men,” Goetz said. Her prince plans to return the table after he removes the purple paint and buffs the table to a high shine. He also might donate money to the park. “My most sincere hope is that cleaning and restoring the bench will make it possible for some other young couple to enjoy a childhood kiss similar to the one I once shared,” he said.

properties.name: San Joaquin Wildlife Sanctuary
properties.description: Posted by Baostar Riparian View, Irvine, CAOnce a degraded marshland, now one of the largest coastal freshwater marshlands in Southern California. Ten miles of trails popular with walkers, joggers, bird-watchers and families out for a scenic, leisurely stroll. Owned by Irvine Ranch Water District and managed by the San Joaquin Wildlife Sanctuary. For information on wildlife education programs and tours, call the Sea & Sage Audubon Society. Area map:

properties.name: Summit Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  Soaring 610 feet in elevation, this picturesque view is at Summit Park, which is located within the gated neighborhoods of The Summit at Turtle Ridge.

properties.name: Sunset at Irvine Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   33.800294,-117.759137You can get a beautiful view of the sunset here.

properties.name: The Carousel
properties.description: Posted by Baostar74 Fortune Drive, Irvine, CAThis carousel is 38 feet in diameter with 32 horses and menagerie animals created from original works by famous carousel maker Gustav Dentzel. There are three rows of animals, with the outer row featuring armored horses. The carousel is illuminated by approximately 1,200 white lights at night with 80 melodies recorded from an original band organ.

properties.name: The Melting Pot
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 2646 Dupont Dr. Ste. C70, Irvine, CA 92612Designed to resemble a romantic American bistro one might have frequented in the \'70s when fondue first appeared on the trend scene, the room\'s color palate is made up of burnt oranges and avocado greens, the semi-private alcoves are dimly lit by retro fixtures and visible wine cases hearken back to a kitschier era. Diners may order a la carte, but the most popular method of eating here is through the pre-planned, four-course "Two on the Town" option, which keeps couples busy for several hours. This popular choice includes the traditional mixture of cheeses and rich sauces for appetizers and entrees while chocolates and caramels are presented for dessert. Not interested in a lengthy meal? The Melting Pot\'s bar has a wine list with over 100 unique vintages (and you can still sample the fondue there as well). -- Michael Alarcon (AOL City Guide)

properties.name: The Rose Garden at Aldrich Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  Aldrich ParkA gently hilly park in center of UCI campus with green lawns, mature trees, exotic flowers, and campus architecture. You can stop and smell the roses and watch many birds on this walk. The rose garden feature 380 roses of 89 varieties that bloom from March to November. You can\'t beat Southern California for roses (psst...bring something to prune them for a love one). The garden is located near the foot of the bridge that leads to the shops and restaurants in University Town Center.

properties.name: The Terrazza at Prego
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 18420 Von Karman Ave, Irvine, CA Prego Ristorante is inspired by the villas of the tuscan countryside. It has the warmth and rustic charm of old-world Italy with the electricity and vibrancy of a cosmopolitan restaurant. There\'s a Terrazza, or the Private Courtyard off the Main Dining Room shaded by a grapevine-laden trellis. The gentle splashing of nearby fountains lends a soothing sound, and the fountains themselves provide lovely backdrops for photographs. Couples getting married often reserve the entire restaurant so that they can take advantage of all its wonderful spaces.

properties.name: Turtle Rock Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  This is a lovely walk through what feels like shaded woodland glens and then a park-like section lined with homes with colorful gardens and fanciful bird houses. The park\'s stream and rustic look makes it a romantic walk.

properties.name: Venta Spur Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  This beautifully landscaped trail is like walking through a botanical garden featuring flowering plants, cacti, trees, rock-lined streambed and the remains of a eucalyptus windrow. The first rail line in Irvine was put down in 1887 and this Venta Spur route served the orange packing house by the former base as well as the Frances Packing House on the former Shop Road (now Yale). The trail is well-lighted and provides a stroll through mature trees that provide refuge to many birds and one may see an occasional rabbit or bat along the way as well.

properties.name: Woodbridge Lakes Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar The two lakes of Woodbridge, with their bridges, gazebos, beaches, parks and quiet walkways is one of the most popular areas in the city. Walkers can travel along the edge of both North Lake and South Lake on this gently winding, lighted walkway. It curves away from the lake and passes around lakeside neighborhoods in several places. Along this trail, you can stop at benches that overlook the lakes and watch a peaceful sunset, greet dogs, pass someone feeding the ducks or fishing, visit a quiet island or two, or stop for coffee and a bite to eat at the shopping center.

properties.name: You'll swoon over the moon
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  1 Bommer Canyon Road, Irvine, CA 92603You can take in the view of the city lights here with an easy two-hour escape not far from the hustle and bustle of urban life. On one side of the trail we have hills and moon. On the other, the 73 Toll Road. But looking behind and below are city lights to enhance the experience.
